Why is it so?
The nature of an arhat is empty of the nature of an arhat, the nature of a pratyekabuddha is empty of the nature of a pratyekabuddha, and the nature of a buddha is empty of the nature of a buddha.

If one wishes to emerge from the dharma of no characteristics, it is to emerge from the fruit of stream-entry, the fruit of once-returning, the fruit of non-returning, the fruit of arhatship, the path of a pratyekabuddha, the path of a buddha, and omniscience.
Why is it so?
The nature of the fruit of stream-entry up to omniscience does not emerge from the three realms and also does not abide in omniscience.
Why is it so?
The fruit of stream-entry up to omniscience, because the nature of omniscience is empty.
If one wishes to transcend the dharma of signlessness, it is to transcend names, provisional marks, and mere language.
Why is this?
Names do not transcend the three realms and also do not abide in omniscience.
Why is this?
Because the mark of names is empty of the mark of names.
Up to provisional establishment, it is the same.
If one wishes to transcend the dharma of signlessness, it is to transcend non-arising, non-cessation, non-defilement, non-purification, non-arising, and non-action.
